page.title: 13 Linear Park Lakes
page.content: The lakes are situated in the middle of Lakeside and Belgrave housing estates. They attract many different birds. Coots often nest in the middle of the lake with their nests raised up out of the water. Moor hens and mallards stay close to the fenced off island in the middle of the lake.A pair of swans can be seen guarding cygnets. The lakes even attract seagulls. Water snails,stickle-backs and frogs can be seen in the water and there is also a pike which eats baby ducklings. Many people have tried to catch the pike but it always escapes to the dark muddy depths of the lake. The lakes are a wonderful place for children to play.
